meanings.definition: A silver coin of ancient Greece.
meanings.sent1: In ancient Greece, people used the diobolon to buy goods.
meanings.sent2: The diobolon was a valuable currency in the past.
meanings.sent3: I found a diobolon under my bed, maybe I'm rich now!
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a shiny diobolon, brightening up the room.
meanings.sent5: The diobolon gleamed in the sunlight, catching everyone's eye.

meanings.definition: A unit of weight equal to 1/6 of a drachma.
meanings.sent1: The recipe called for a diobolon of flour to be added.
meanings.sent2: He measured the spices using a diobolon to get the perfect amount.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally dropped a diobolon of sugar into the soup, oops!
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was light as a diobolon, filling the room with joy.
meanings.sent5: The diobolon of weight on the scale indicated a precise measurement.
